pr_title: Add a config to disable thread pool executor instrumentation for all wrapped tasks

timeline.bodyText: Might it be possible/still correct to hoist this into a final boolean variable? Are rules updated on the fly?
timeline.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText: This is called on construction, so I'm less worried about the cost, but I'm not sure isRuleEnabled is the right method to call.
replies.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: I think you mean that isRuleEnabled was intended for the rule processors? I don't know that this isn't a tracing rule though so I think that method name could use some updating, this is enabling or disabling a flag for the tracer
replies.author: devinsba

replies.bodyText: yeah, it was intended originally for tag interceptors and renamed when I introduced rule processors.  I guess you can leave it as is.  Not that big of deal.
replies.author: tylerbenson

timeline.bodyText: OK, so this checks compatibility. How can we be sure a consumer doesn't see the value? Could it cause an error in the consumer?
timeline.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText:
This is definitely a possible issue source if people do weird things. I couldn't find a better way to test than this.
I'm not entirely convinced this check is necessary actually. I can't think of a case in which a lambda would get wrapped (passed through execute/submit/etc.), and not be a plain Runnable. Maybe a custom ThreadPoolExecutor impl which has a submit/execute that takes a concrete type that implements runnable. I'm not sure how bytebuddy would view such a method
replies.author: devinsba

replies.bodyText: I wonder if it would work reliably because of erasure of the queue's generic type. Where are you expecting the CCE to happen? Custom queues?
replies.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText: It might just result in generic type pollution and I suspect you couldn't detect incompatibility without being the consumer.
replies.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText: To be clear this code was already here, but yeah I would expect custom Queues
replies.author: devinsba

replies.bodyText: I thought this was new, sorry. I still wonder if it's correct and has no dangerous side effects.
replies.author: richardstartin
